documentType: Bureau of Prisons incident report and related memoranda
summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons Form 583 Report of Incident and associated staff memoranda detailing the discovery of Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, the medical response, and his subsequent death. It includes staff rosters and assignment logs from that day.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. on August 10, 2019, and later pronounced deceased. He is the subject of the incident report.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Listed as staff involved in the incident on the Form 583 and appears on the daily assignment roster as assigned to SHU #1.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Listed as staff involved in the incident on the Form 583 and appears on the daily assignment roster as assigned to SHU #2.

persons.name: K. Cale
persons.context: Responded to the medical emergency, helped transport Epstein on a stretcher, and provided an escort to the hospital. Also appears on the staff roster.

persons.name: Dupree
persons.context: Requested an AED during the medical response and is listed on the staff assignment roster.

persons.name: Darlene Imeri
persons.context: Responded to the body alarm, helped retrieve a stretcher and an AED for inmate Epstein.

persons.name: Jean
persons.context: Referenced as the Operations Lieutenant who instructed staff to report to the hospital and is listed on the daily assignment roster.

persons.name: Medina
persons.context: Appears on the daily assignment roster as the OPS LT for the 16:00 - 00:00 shift.

connections.description: Noel was a correctional officer assigned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where Epstein was housed on the morning of the incident.
Thomas was a correctional officer assigned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where Epstein was housed on the morning of the incident.
Cale responded to the medical emergency, helped transport Epstein, and escorted him to the hospital.
Imeri, a psychologist, responded to the body alarm and assisted in retrieving medical equipment for Epstein.
Jean is identified as an Operations Lieutenant, a supervisory role, while Cale is a Senior Officer Specialist who responded to the incident.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

events.title: Medical Response and Transport
events.description: Staff initiated CPR, called EMS, and transported Epstein to the Health Services unit and then to New York Presbyterian – Lower Manhattan Hospital. EMS arrived at 6:43 a.m., and transport to the hospital occurred at approximately 7:10 a.m.

events.title: Pronouncement of Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was pronounced deceased at 7:36 a.m. at the hospital. The cause was reported as cardiac arrest.

events.title: Remains Transported to Morgue
events.description: Epstein's remains were moved to the hospital morgue and later transported to the city morgue by the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) staff around 12:57 p.m.

events.title: Staff Instructed Not to Speak to Media
events.description: A lieutenant instructed escorting staff not to speak to anyone or the media regarding the situation and to direct inquiries to the MCC NY Public Relations Officer.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York (150 Park Row)
New York Presbyterian – Lower Manhattan Hospital (170 William Street, New York, NY 10038)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:33 a.m.
The incident report notes 'circumferential bruising around the neck' was observed on Epstein by institution medical staff.
Epstein was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. at a local hospital; the reported cause was cardiac arrest.
Staff were instructed by a lieutenant not to speak to anyone or the media about the incident.
The document includes detailed staff rosters and assignment logs for August 10, 2019, showing personnel on duty at the time of the incident.
